result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Public Defender appointment

11:03 AM Defendant Zarkonia H. Kivlin in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Zarkonia H. Kivlin.  Attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2. Set out for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on December 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Any previously ordered bond conditions would continue

2:33 PM Defendant Zarkonia H. Kivlin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Zarkonia H. Kivlin.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dolch states cases and appearances and explains nonappearance by DE.  State responds - requests cash bonds be reinstated and the amount be increased to a total of $500 per case.  Atty Dolch requests the cash be reinstated in all three cases.  Court notes there is no BFH at this time.  Court orders cash bonds reinstated and orders an additional $100.00 cash in each case.  Any previously ordered bond conditions would continue.  PH on 10/13/22 at 10:45 a.m.  21CT196 to track.

21CT196 - $100.00 additional cash bond ordered
22CF283 - $100.00 additional cash bond ordered
22CF336 - $100.00 additional cash bond ordered
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Body
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $200.00

11:21 AM Defendant Zarkonia H. Kivlin not in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Zarkonia H. Kivlin.  Attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for State of Wisconsin.   Atty Getsinger has no record to make of DE's non-appearance.  State requests a warrant and bond forfeiture to commence.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant and bond forfeiture proceedings to commence.

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zarkonia H. Kivlin in court.  Atty Annie Getsinger also appears w/the DE.  Court states cases and appearances.  DE likely does qualify for PD in 22CF336 noting she's already been appointed in other cases.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  State makes bail argument - requests $300 cash.  Atty Getsinger responds - requests signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing in 22CF336.  $150.00 cash bond set in 22CF336.  Special bond conditions in 22CF336 as follows:  Absolute sobriety and not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  Bond/conditions continue in 22CF283 and 21CT196.  Atty Getsinger has discussed the 2 older cases today and would like to waive time limits in all matters so they can track for a PTC/PH.  DE agrees to waive her time limits for the PH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Hearing on August 25, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zarkonia H. Kivlin not in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Zarkonia H. Kivlin. Atty. Getsinger got email that DE had transportation issues.  State objects to stay.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stayed.
Return date scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
